Instruction: In a separate bowl, mix together taco seasoning, corn, and tomato sauce. Stir into the beef mixture and cook until hot, about 3 minutes.
Lay out the aluminum foil pieces and spoon equal portions of the beef mixture onto the center of each piece.
Wrap each burrito tightly in aluminum foil and place on a baking sheet.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Set up the milk cartons in a safe cooking area outdoors. Ignite each carton at one of the vents and cook until they burn down, approximately 2 minutes. Carefully unwrap the burritos using heatproof gloves.
Substitute corn tortillas for flour tortillas if preferred. Customize the fillings to suit your taste.
Feel free to add other ingredients such as beans, corn, or grilled vegetables to enhance the filling.
Use care when unwrapping the burritos, as they will be extremely hot. Make sure to wear heatproof gloves.
